name: Zola's Adventure Garlic Bread
author: STEPH577
summary: A family friend who owns two local cafes gave me this recipe.  It is a delicious and surprising twist on plain old garlic bread.  Don't be fooled by the unusual ingredients, the sweet and salty flavors are perfect complements to each other!  All the ingredient amounts are approximate, so adjust them to suit your tastes.
ingredients: 2 cups trail mix with dried cranberries, without chocolate pieces
1 (1 pound) loaf round focaccia bread, cut in half horizontally
⅔ cup freshly grated Romano cheese
directions: Melt 1/2 cup of butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Add the onion; cook and stir until deep brown, about 15 minutes
Stir in the maple syrup and trail mix
Heat to 300 to 310 degrees F (149 to 154 degrees C), or until a small amount of syrup drizzled from a spoon forms hard, brittle threads
Pour onto parchment paper, and allow to cool
In a small bowl, stir together the remaining butter and garlic
Spread onto the cut side of the focaccia bread halves
Crumble the candied trail mix and onion over the garlic butter, and top with Romano cheese
Place the focaccia onto a baking sheet
Broil for 3 to 5 minutes, or until golden brown
